questions.question: A child presents with a painful, swollen knee after a minor fall. The x-ray shows a spiral fracture of the tibia. Which concern must the nurse keep in mind?
options: This injury pattern may be associated with non-accidental trauma
Spiral fractures always indicate osteogenesis imperfecta
This injury requires immediate surgical fixation in all cases
This fracture pattern usually heals poorly and leads to permanent disability

questions.question: Which nursing intervention is most important when caring for a child in skeletal traction?
options: Encouraging the child to remove weights briefly to reposition
Ensuring weights hang freely and are not resting on the floor
Frequently adjusting the amount of weight based on the child’s pain
Placing the bed in high Fowler’s position at all times
